content: tuxedo squid keychain by kakapocrochet materials scrap amounts - red yarn - green yarn - white yarn - black felt or black yarn or safety eyes - a key ring - stuffing - a hook 1 size down from the recommended hook for your yarn abbreviations us - magic_ring magic_ring if you can t do this you can ch2 slip_stitch chain then work into the centre of the ch2 loop - chain chain - slip_stitch slip_stitch - single_crochet single_crochet - decrease decrease - increase increase - half_double_crochet half_double_crochet keyring pic 1 put the yarn through the ring | pic 2 cross your yarn over like a normal magic_ring | pic 3 go under the first strand on the back of your fingers and grab the second one making a loop pic 4 get your hook now and insert it into the loop you just made | pic 5 yo and ch1 to secure the loop | pic 6 do your 4sc then pull the short tail really tight crochet over the remaining short tail to secure it body r1 magic_ring around the key ring page above 4sc r2 2 single_crochet increase r3 2 2sc increase r4 4 single_crochet increase r5 single_crochet around r6 4 2sc increase r7-9 single_crochet around 3 rounds r10 blo 4 2sc decrease stuff the tip r11 4 single_crochet decrease r12 blo 3dec fo legs attach yarn to the fl from the last round 9 slip_stitch into next stitch ch10 increase 8sc slip_stitch into where we chained out of fo head fins do this twice the frist one should be paralell with the second one attach yarn one st below r1 stitch one slip_stitch stitch two single_crochet ch2 half_double_crochet chain slip_stitch tie ch10 9sc fo and sew it so it s a ring put the ring around the legs sew it closed the closed part should be on the same side as the face so you can cover it with a bowtie bow r1 ch3 2sc r2 decrease r3 2sc
